<xen:title>{xen:phrase configure_importer}: {$name}</xen:title>
<xen:form action="{xen:adminlink import/config}">
<xen:selectunit name="config[node_id]" label="{xen:phrase th_social_category_socialgroups}:"> <xen:options source="$nodeOptions" /> </xen:selectunit>
<xen:submitunit save="{xen:phrase validate_configuration}" />
<input type="hidden" name="config[retain_keys]" value="{$retainKeys}" /> <input type="hidden" name="importer" value="{$importer}" /> </xen:form>

<xen:controlunit label="{$preparedOption.title}" hint="{$formatParams.hint}"> <xen:explain>{xen:raw $preparedOption.explain}</xen:explain> <xen:html> <xen:select name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][0]" value="{$preparedOption.option_value.0}" inputclass="autoSize"> <xen:option value="last_post_date">{xen:phrase last_message_time}</xen:option> <xen:option value="title">{xen:phrase title_alphabetical}</xen:option> <xen:option value="discussion_count">{xen:phrase th_number_of_discussions_socialgroups}</xen:option> <xen:option value="member_count">{xen:phrase th_number_of_members_socialgroups}</xen:option> </xen:select> <xen:select name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][1]" value="{$preparedOption.option_value.1}" inputclass="autoSize"> <xen:option value="asc">{xen:phrase ascending}</xen:option> <xen:option value="desc">{xen:phrase descending}</xen:option> </xen:select> <xen:include template="option_list_option_editlink" /> <input type="hidden" name="{$listedFieldName}" value="{$preparedOption.option_id}" /> {xen:raw $editLink} </xen:html> </xen:controlunit>

<xen:require css="th_option_onoff_nodeselect_socialgroups.css" /> <xen:checkboxunit hint="{$preparedOption.hint}" class="onOffNodeSelect"> <xen:label>{$_preparedOption.title}</xen:label> <xen:option selected="{$preparedOption.option_value}"> <xen:label>{$preparedOption.title}</xen:label> <xen:radio name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][_type]"> <xen:option value="_all" selected="!{$preparedOption.option_value._type} || {$preparedOption.option_value._type} == '_all'">{xen:phrase th_in_all_social_categories_socialgroups}</xen:option> <xen:option value="_some" selected="{$preparedOption.option_value._type} == '_some'"> <xen:label>{xen:phrase th_in_following_social_categories_socialgroups}:</xen:label> <xen:checkbox name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}]" value="{$preparedOption.option_value}"> <xen:options source="$formatParams" /> </xen:checkbox> </xen:option> <xen:comment><xen:option value="_permissions" selected="{$preparedOption.option_value._type} == '_permissions'">{xen:phrase th_from_permissions_socialgroups}</xen:option></xen:comment> <xen:explain>{xen:raw $preparedOption.explain}</xen:explain> <xen:html> <input type="hidden" name="{$listedFieldName}" value="{$preparedOption.option_id}" /> {xen:raw $editLink} </xen:html> </xen:radio> <xen:hint>{xen:raw $preparedOption.explain}</xen:hint> </xen:option> <xen:html> <input type="hidden" name="{$listedFieldName}" value="{$preparedOption.option_id}" /> {xen:raw $editLink} </xen:html> </xen:checkboxunit>

{xen:phrase th_new_thread_email_html_footer_1_socialgroups, 'social_forum={$socialForum.title}', 'board={$xenOptions.boardTitle}'}

phrases.phrase: Options for the [âŒ‚] Social Groups add-on.
Disabling this option will stop social forum creators from being able to close their group and stop any members with the appropriate permissions from joining it.
This adds an option to a user's personal details settings to set their primary/favorite social forum. A user must already be a member of a social forum to set it as their primary social forum.

This adds an option to a user's personal details settings to select their secondary social forums. The maximum number of secondary social forums can be set in permissions. A user must already be a member of a social forum to add it to their list of secondary social forums.
Allow social forums to override user style choice
Disabling this option will stop social forum creators from being able to override the user's style for their social forum.
Enabling this option will override a user's privacy settings and always send alerts to users who are watching a thread in a social forum.
Automatically add created social forums to user's secondary list...
Enabling this option automatically adds any social forums created by a user to their list of secondary social forums, provided they haven't already selected the maximum number of social forums.
Default Sort Order for Social Categories
This is the default sort order for social forums in a social category.
Enable extended social forum post bit

This includes each social forum avatar on a new line in the user's post bit, with the name of the social forum on the right. This option requires the option to display primary and/or secondary social forums in post bit to be selected.
This will add social forums to the moderation queue unless a user has the 'Edit Social Forum' and 'Delete Social Forum' permission.
In order to allow users to join social groups in one click, preferences are not shown. This option allows you to set the default values for newly registered users.
Default permission set for all users of Social Groups

Select the default additional permissions given to users who join individual Social Groups. These are on top of the permissions granted to all users in a particular Social Category, which can be customised on a per-node basis.
Show primary social forum in post bit
This shows a user's primary social forum (if selected) in their post bit.
Show primary social forum in signature
This shows a user's primary social forum (if selected) in their signature.
Show secondary social forum in post bit
This shows a user's secondary social forums (if selected) in their post bit.
Show secondary social forum in signature
This shows a user's secondary social forums (if selected) in their signature.
Show child nodes in social category
If enabled, any child nodes of the social category will be shown above the list of social forums.
Show child nodes in social forums
If enabled, any child nodes of the parent social category will be shown in every social forum.

If checked, all social forums will display a sidebar on the right hand side.
Enabling this may break some add-ons that edit the forum_view template.
Show 'Watched Social Forums' link in navigation bar
Unchecking this option will remove the 'Watched Social Forums' link from the navigation bar in XenForo 1.2+. Watching Social Forums is not available in XenForo 1.1 and below.
Allow URL portions for social forums
If enabled and entered, the URL to the social forum will not contain an ID. Once a URL portion is entered, changing this value will cause URLs to be broken.
Use creator's avatar as default social forum avatar
If checked, the social forum creator's avatar will be used by default as the avatar for the social forum.
Watching Social Forums is not available in XenForo 1.1 and below.
Approve request to join social forum
Reject request to join social forum
Allow new messages to be posted in social groups
Allow polls to be created in social groups
Allow social groups to override user style choice
Allow URL portions to be edited once set
The selected user is already a member of this social group.
Count messages posted in social groups toward user total
If disabled, messages posted (directly) in social groups in this social category will not contribute towards the posting user's total messages count.
If disabled, threads from social groups in this social category will never appear in the list of new / unread threads when users run /find-new/threads.
If disabled, users will not be able to post new messages or edit or delete their own messages. Moderators will still be able to manage the contents of social groups.
If disabled, users will not be given the option to create a poll when posting a thread or to add one later. If a thread with a poll is moved into a social group, it will keep the poll.
If enabled, a moderator will have to manually approve any messages posted in social groups in this social category.
If enabled, a moderator will have to manually approve replies posted to threads in social groups.
If enabled, a moderator will have to manually approve threads posted in social groups.
If entered, the URL to this social category will not contain an ID. Use a-z, 0-9, _, and - characters only. Note that once specified, changing this value will cause URLs to be broken.
Include threads from social groups when users click "What's New?"

Hi {to},
You have been invited to join the following group: [url="{url}"]{title}[/url]
Please click on the link above to accept the invite.
{from}
All requests to join must be approved by a Social Forum moderator
Your membership of the social forum {title} has been revoked.
Moderate all messages posted in social groups
Moderate new threads posted in social groups
Moderate replies posted in social groups

{receiver}, {poster} created a thread in the social forum {social_forum_title} at {board}.

{receiver_username},
{username} created a new thread in the social forum {social_forum_title} at {board_title}.
"{title}"
----------------------------------------------------------------------
To view this thread, click here: {view_link}
You will not receive any further emails about this thread until you have read the new messages.
----------------------------------------------------------------------

{board_link}

{receiver_username},
{username} created a new thread in the social forum {social_forum_title} at {board_title}.
"{title}"
This is the message they posted: ---------------------------------------------------------------------- {message} ----------------------------------------------------------------------
To view this thread, click here: {view_link}
You will not receive any further emails about this thread until you have read the new messages.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
This message was sent to you because you joined the social forum "{social_forum_title}" at {board_title} and opted in to email notification of new threads.
{board_link}
This user is not a member of any social forums.
There are no social forum members to display.
People may request to join this Social Forum
Please enter a URL portion using a-z, 0-9, _, and - characters only.
You have been promoted to a moderator of the social forum {title}.
You have been removed as moderator of the social forum {title}.
The requested social category could not be found.
The requested social forum could not be found.
Your request to join the social forum {title} has been approved.
Your request to join the social forum {title} has been rejected.
Require URL portions for all social forums
The social forum creator is not able to leave the group.
This social forum is currently closed and can not be joined.
The social forum is not empty.
The social forum could not be found.
Sticky social forums appear at the top of the first page of the list of social forums in their parent social category
Are you sure you want to delete {socialForum}?
There are no social forums to display.
This is a list of all members who have joined {social_forum_title}.
URL portions must contain more than just numbers or a "-".
URL portions must be unique. The specified name is already in use.
The URL portion cannot be changed once set.
User has created at least X social forums
User has joined at least X social forums
Watch forum when user joins social forum
{name} has invited you to join the social forum {title}.
{name} has requested to join the social forum {title}.
Your social forum has been created.
Your social forum has been updated.
You are not watching any social forums.

<xen:title>{xen:phrase th_move_social_forum_socialgroups}: {$socialForum.title}</xen:title>
<xen:navigation> <xen:breadcrumb source="$nodeBreadCrumbs" /> <xen:breadcrumb href="{xen:link full:threads, $thread}">{xen:helper threadPrefix, $thread}{$thread.title}</xen:breadcrumb> </xen:navigation>
<xen:container var="$bodyClasses">{xen:helper nodeClasses, $nodeBreadCrumbs, $forum}</xen:container>
<form action="{xen:link 'social-forums/move', $socialForum}" method="post" class="xenForm formOverlay">
<dl class="ctrlUnit"> <dt><label for="ctrl_node_id">{xen:phrase th_destination_social_category_socialgroups}:</label></dt> <dd> <select name="move_to_node_id" id="ctrl_move_to_node_id" class="textCtrl selectSocialCategory"> <xen:foreach loop="$nodeOptions" value="$node"> <option value="{$node.node_id}" {xen:selected '{$node.node_id} == {$socialForum.node_id}'} {xen:if "{$node.node_type_id} != 'SocialCategory'", 'disabled="disabled"'}>{xen:string repeat, '  ', $node.depth}{$node.title}</option> </xen:foreach> </select> </dd> </dl>
<dl class="ctrlUnit submitUnit"> <dt></dt> <dd><input type="submit" value="{xen:phrase th_move_social_forum_socialgroups}" class="button primary" /></dd> </dl>
<input type="hidden" name="_xfConfirm" value="1" /> <input type="hidden" name="_xfToken" value="{$visitor.csrf_token_page}" /> </form>

    {xen:phrase new_threads}{xen:phrase new_messages}, {xen:phrase alerts}, {xen:phrase emails}

modification.description: Shows name of social forum in mixed-forum thread lists (i.e. New Posts).
Adds a link for Watched Social Forums to the navigation menu.
